units.title: Electroporate hiPS cells with donor and gRNA plasmids
units.text: hiPS cells (2 × 106 cells) dissociated with accutase (Innovative Cell Technologies, catalogue no. AT104) were electroporated using the P3 Primary Cell 4D-NucleofectorTM X Kit L (Lonza, catalogue no. V4XP-3024), a 4D-nucleofector core unit and X unit (Lonza; nucleofection program no. CA-137).
units.rationale: This is a direct, actionable step in genetic modification of hiPS cells using electroporation.

units.title: Seed electroporated cells on vitronectin-coated plates with ROCK inhibitor
units.text: Cells were seeded on a well of a six-well plate that was precoated with vitronectin and contained prewarmed Essential 8 medium supplemented with the ROCK inhibitor Y27632 (10 µM; Selleckchem, catalogue no. S1049).
units.rationale: This step specifies the exact culture conditions post-electroporation for cell survival and recovery.

units.title: Select transfected colonies with puromycin
units.text: Once the seeded cells reached 70–80% confluency, 1 µg ml−1 of puromycin in StemFlex medium (Life Technologies, catalogue no. A3349401) was supplemented for 5 days.
units.rationale: This is a clear selection protocol step to isolate successfully transfected cells using puromycin.

units.title: Pick and expand puromycin-resistant colonies
units.text: Colonies were visible at the end of 5 days of selection in puromycin. Cells were maintained in StemFlex medium for another 5 days, and individual colonies were picked and maintained separately in a 24-well plate coated with vitronectin.
units.rationale: This describes the manual isolation and expansion of single colonies after selection, a key protocol step.

units.title: Validate donor integration via three PCR assays
units.text: Three sets of PCR programs were designed to select colonies that showed the insertion of the left, middle and right parts of the donor DNA (PCR1, 5′-TCCTGAGTCCGGACCACTTT and 3′-CACCGCATGTTAGAAGACTTCC; PCR2, 5′-TATGGAGATCCCTCGACCTG and 3′-CCTGGGATACCCCGAAGAGT; PCR3, 5′-TTCTTCTTGATGCTGTGCCG and 3′-GCTCAAGGGGCTTCATGATG).
units.rationale: This is a specific, actionable molecular validation protocol using defined primer sequences.

units.title: Select Dlxi1/2b::eGFP-expressing cells with hygromycin
units.text: One day after passaging, 200 µg ml−1 hygromycin was added to the medium to select for infected cells. Cells were maintained in hygromycin for 9 days.
units.rationale: This is a clear antibiotic selection protocol to isolate lentivirally transduced cells.

units.title: Differentiate hiPS cells into hCO aggregates in AggreWell plates
units.text: About 3 × 106 cells were seeded per AggreWell 800 plate well in Essential 8 medium supplemented with the ROCK inhibitor Y27632 (10 µM). The plate was then centrifuged at 100g for 3 min and incubated overnight at 37 °C with 5% CO2.
units.rationale: This is a precise, reproducible protocol step for generating 3D organoid aggregates from single cells.

units.title: Culture hCO in E6 medium with patterning molecules
units.text: The next day (day 0), cellular aggregates were transferred into ultra-low attachment plastic dishes (Corning, catalogue no. 3262) and cultured in Essential 6 medium (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. A1516401) supplemented with dorsomorphin (2.5 µM, Sigma-Aldrich, catalogue no. P5499), SB-431542 (10 µM, R&D Systems, catalogue no. 1614) and XAV-939 (1.25 µM, Tocris, catalogue no. 3748).
units.rationale: This specifies the exact medium and small molecule conditions for early hCO differentiation.

units.title: Switch hCO to neural medium with growth factors on day 6
units.text: On day 6, organoids were transferred to neural medium containing Neurobasal A (Thermo Fisher, catalogue no. 10888022), B-27 supplement without vitamin A (Life Technologies, catalogue no. 12587), GlutaMax (1:100, Life Technologies, catalogue no. 35050061) and penicillin-streptomycin (1:100, Thermo Fisher, catalogue no. 15140163). Neural medium was supplemented with 20 ng ml−1 EGF (R&D Systems) and 20 ng ml−1 FGF2 (R&D Systems) from day 6 to 24 with daily medium change in the first 10 days, and every other day for the subsequent 9 days.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, time-resolved protocol for medium transition and growth factor supplementation during hCO maturation.

units.title: Add gellan gum to prevent organoid fusion
units.text: Gellan gum (roughly 0.005%, Sigma, catalogue no. G1919-259G, lot SLCF5726) was added in the medium from day 6 to 15 to avoid spontaneous organoid fusion.
units.rationale: This is a specific, actionable step to control organoid morphology during culture.
